The 'North American Aviation T-6 Texan' was a single-engine advanced trainer
aircraft used to train pilots of the United States Army Air Forces, United
States Navy, Royal Air Force and other air forces of the British Commonwealth
during World War II and into the 1950s. Designed by North American Aviation, the
T-6 is known by a variety of designations depending on the model and operating
air force. The USAAC and USAAF designated it as the 'AT-6', the United States
Navy the 'SNJ', and British Commonwealth air forces, the 'Harvard', the name it
is best known by outside of the US. After 1962, US forces designated it the 'T-
6'. It remains a popular warbird aircraft used for airshow demonstrations and
static displays.
categories: World War II trainer aircraft of the United States
